Package project_1

Class CollectionManager

java.lang.Object
project_1.CollectionManager
public class CollectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
This is the main running class that handles valid inputs and operations based on the requirements given in Project 1. It takes in inputs with the format -> (Instruction, Album Name, Author, Genre, Date). Instruction: A | Takes 4 inputs | Adds an album D | Takes 2 Inputs | Deletes an album L | Takes 2 inputs | Lend out an album R | Takes 2 inputs | Return an album P | Takes no input | Display collection without order PD| Takes no input | Display collection by release date PG| Takes no input | Display Collection in Genre Order Q | takes no input | Stop execution and display "Collection Manager Terminated
Author:
Ethan Chang, Kevin Cubillos

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs a loop that takes in a certain amount of arguments, it can be terminated by entering Q into the Command Line

    • checkInstruction

      public boolean checkInstruction​(java.lang.String[] input)
      This checks whether the input is valid, and will call each method that is attributed to each instruction.
      Parameters:
      input - the input array Index 0 = Instruction, 1 = Name, 2 = Author, 3 = Genre, 4 = Date
      Returns:
      returns false if instruction is "Q"

    • addAlbum

      public void addAlbum​(java.lang.String[] input)
      This will Add the Album to the Collection
      Parameters:
      input - the input array Index 0 = Instruction, 1 = Name, 2 = Author, 3 = Genre, 4 = Date

    • deleteAlbum

      public void deleteAlbum​(java.lang.String[] input)
      This will Delete the Album from the Collection
      Parameters:
      input - the input array Index 0 = Instruction, 1 = Name, 2 = Author, 3 = Genre, 4 = Date

    • lendAlbum

      public void lendAlbum​(java.lang.String[] input)
      This will Lend the Album from the Collection
      Parameters:
      input - the input array Index 0 = Instruction, 1 = Name, 2 = Author

    • returnAlbum

      public void returnAlbum​(java.lang.String[] input)
      This will Return the Album to the Collection
      Parameters:
      input - the input array Index 0 = Instruction, 1 = Name, 2 = Author, 3 = Genre, 4 = Date

    • printAlbums

      public void printAlbums​(java.lang.String[] input, int type)
      This will Print the Albums in a certain order
      Parameters:
      input - the input array Index 0 = Instruction, 1 = Name, 2 = Author, 3 = Genre, 4 = Date
      type - 1 = no order, 2 = by Date, 3 = by Genre
